title: Bug 102516 - JDBC Data Set Editor should load tables and columns on demand
description:
Bug 102516 - JDBC Data Set Editor should load tables and columns on demand

The JDBC Data Set Editor page for a SQL Query has a tree control that lists the tables and columns in your data source. Currently, on the iSeries platform using the JTOpen JDBC drivers, this tree control shows every schema (aka catalog) on the system. This can easily be several hundred tables. The code in CVS from 6/30/05 contains a schema filter, but a warning message still appears on load because the tree is being populated on load.

It is requested to defer the loading of the tree until the user either expands the tree or applies a filter.
OB: On the iSeries platform using the JTOpen JDBC drivers, the tree control in the JDBC Data Set Editor shows every schema (aka catalog) on the system. This is easily several hundred tables. Despite the schema filter in the code from CVS on 6/30/05, a warning message is displayed on load due to the tree being populated on load.
EB: The loading of the tree should be deferred until the user expands the tree or applies a filter.
SR:
1. Launch the JDBC Data Set Editor page for a SQL Query on the iSeries platform.
2. Observe that the tree control is populated with every schema (aka catalog) on the system, resulting in several hundred tables.
3. Verify that a warning message is displayed on load due to the tree being populated on load.
4. Expand the tree or apply a filter.
5. Verify that the tables and columns are loaded on-demand, without any warning messages.
